Home > external > kegg > getKEGGModelForOrganism.m

getKEGGModelForOrganism

PURPOSE

getKEGGModelForOrganism

SYNOPSIS

function model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,outDir,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioKO,minScoreRatioG,maxPhylDist,nSequences,seqIdentity)

DESCRIPTION 

 getKEGGModelForOrganism
   Reconstructs a genome-scale metabolic model based on protein homology
   to the orthologies in KEGG. If the target species is not available in
   KEGG, the user must select a closely related species. It is also
   possible to circumvent protein homology search (see fastaFile parameter
   for more details)

   Input:
   organismID          three or four letter abbreviation of the organism
                       (as used in KEGG). If not available, use a closely
                       related species. This is used for determing the
                       phylogenetic distance. Use 'eukaryotes' or
                       'prokaryotes' to get a model for the whole domain.
                       Only applicable if fastaFile is empty, i.e. no
                       homology search should be performed
   fastaFile           a FASTA file that contains the protein sequences of
                       the organism for which to reconstruct a model (opt,
                       if no FASTA file is supplied then a model is
                       reconstructed based only on the organism
                       abbreviation. This option ignores all settings
                       except for keepSpontaneous, keepUndefinedStoich,
                       keepIncomplete and keepGeneral)
   dataDir             directory for which to retrieve the input data.
                       Should contain a combination of these sub-folders:
                       -dataDir\keggdb
                           The KEGG database files used in 1a (see below)
                       -dataDir\fasta
                           The multi-FASTA files generated in 1b (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\aligned
                           The aligned FASTA files as generated in 2a (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\hmms
                           The hidden Markov models as generated in 2b or
                           downloaded from BioMet Toolbox (see below)
                       The final directory in dataDir should be styled as
                       proXXX_keggYY or eukXXX_keggYY, indicating whether
                       the HMMs were trained on pro- or eukaryotic
                       sequences, using a sequence similarity threshold of
                       XXX %, fitting the KEGG version YY. E.g.
                       euk100_kegg82. (opt, see note about fastaFile. Note
                       that in order to rebuild the KEGG model from a
                       database dump, as opposed to using the version
                       supplied with RAVEN, you would still need to supply
                       this)
   outDir              directory to save the results from the quering of
                       the hidden Markov models. The output is specific
                       for the input sequences and the settings used. It
                       is stored in this manner so that the function can
                       continue if interrupted or if it should run in
                       parallel. Be careful not to leave output files from
                       different organisms or runs with different settings
                       in the same folder. They will not be overwritten
                       (opt, default is a temporary dir where all *.out
                       files are deleted before and after doing the
                       reconstruction)
   keepSpontaneous     include reactions labeled as "spontaneous". (opt,
                       default true)
   keepUndefinedStoich    include reactions in the form n A <=> n+1 A. These
                       will be dealt with as two separate metabolites
                       (opt, default true)
   keepIncomplete      include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear" (opt,
                       default true)
   keepGeneral         include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "general reaction". These are reactions on the form
                       "an aldehyde <=> an alcohol", and are therefore
                       unsuited for modelling purposes. Note that not all
                       reactions have this type of annotation, and the
                       script will therefore not be able to remove all
                       such reactions (opt, default false)
   cutOff              significance score from HMMer needed to assign
                       genes to a KO (opt, default 10^-50)
   minScoreRatioG      a gene is only assigned to KOs for which the score
                       is >=log(score)/log(best score) for that gene. This
                       is to prevent that a gene which clearly belongs to
                       one KO is assigned also to KOs with much lower
                       scores (opt, default 0.8 (lower is less strict))
   minScoreRatioKO     ignore genes in a KO if their score is
                       <log(score)/log(best score in KO). This is to
                       "prune" KOs which have many genes and where some are
                       clearly a better fit (opt, default 0.3 (lower is
                       less strict))
   maxPhylDist         -1: only use sequences from the same domain
                       (Prokaryota, Eukaryota)
                       other (positive) value: only use sequences for
                       organisms where the phylogenetic distance is at the
                       most this large (as calculated in getPhylDist)
                       (opt, default Inf, which means that all sequences
                       will be used)
   nSequences          for each KO, use up to this many sequences from the
                       most closely related species. This is mainly to
                       speed up the alignment process for KOs with very
                       many genes. This subsampling is performed before
                       running CD-HIT (opt, default inf)
   seqIdentity         sequence identity threshold in CD-HIT, referred as
                       "global sequence identity" in CD-HIT User's Guide.
                       The only possible options are 1 (100 %), 0.9 (90 %)
                       and 0.5 (50 %). If other values are provided,
                       CD-HIT is skipped (opt, default -1, i.e. CD-HIT is
                       skipped)

   Output:
   model               the reconstructed model

   PLEASE READ THIS: The input to this function can be confusing, because
   it is intended to be run in parallel on a cluster or in multiple
   sessions. It therefore saves a lot of intermediate results to storage.
   This also serves the purpose of not having to do redundant
   calculations. This, however, comes with the disadvantage of somewhat
   trickier handling. This is what this function does:

   1a. Loads files from a local KEGG FTP dump and constructs a general
       RAVEN model representing the metabolic network. The functions
       getRxnsFromKEGG, getGenesFromKEGG, getMetsFromKEGG summarise the
       data into 'keggRxns.mat', 'keggGenes.mat' and 'keggMets.mat' files,
       which are later merged into 'keggModel.mat' by getModelFromKEGG
       function. The function getPhylDist generates 'keggPhylDist.mat'
       file. KEGG FTP access requires a <a href="matlab:
       web('http://www.bioinformatics.jp/en/keggftp.html')">license</a>.
   1b. Generates protein FASTA files from the KEGG FTP dump (see 1a). One
       multi-FASTA file for each KO in KEGG is generated.

   The Step 1 has to be re-done every time KEGG updates their database (or
   rather when the updates are large enough to warrant re-running this
   part). Many users would probably never use this feature.

   2a. Filters KO-specific protein sets. This is done by using the
       settings "maxPhylDist" and "nSequences" to control which sequences
       should be used for constructing Hidden Markov models (HMMs), and
       later for matching your sequences to.
       The most common alternatives here would be to use sequences from
       only eukaryotes, only prokaryotes or all sequences in KEGG. As
       explained in the README.md file, various sets of pre-trained hidden
       Markov models are available at <a href="matlab:
       web('http://biomet-toolbox.chalmers.se/index.php?page=downtools-raven')">BioMet
       Toolbox</a>. This is normally the most convenient way, but if you
       would like to use, for example, only fungal sequences for training
       the HMMs then you need to re-run this step.
   2b. KO-specific protein FASTA files are re-organised into
       non-redundant protein sets with CD-HIT. The user can only set
       seqIdentity parameter, which corresponds to '-c' parameter in
       CD-HIT, described as "sequence identity threshold". The following
       non-default parameter settings are used depending on seqIdentity
       value:
       __________________________________________________________________
       |                           |         seqIdentity value          |
       |                           --------------------------------------
       |                           |  1.0   |  0.9   |  0.5   |    x    |
       | CD-HIT parameters         -------------------------------------|
       -----------------------------------------------------------------|
       | Input Dataset (-i)        | raw    | cdh100 | cdh90  | raw     |
       | Output Dataset (-o)       | cdh100 | cdh90  | cdh50  | cdhOth  |
       | Sequence identity (-c)    | 1.0    | 0.9    | 0.5    | x       |
       | word_length (-n)          | 5      | 5      | 4      | 2-5*    |
       | Max available memory (-M) |               2000                 |
       ------------------------------------------------------------------        
       * - word length depends from sequence identity value (see CD-HIT
       manual for more details)

       The table reads as follows: if seqIdentity is equal to 1, then
       "cdh100" set is produced from raw set of proteins. If seqIdentity
       is equal to 0.9, then "cdh90" is produced from "cdh100" proteins
       set. When seqIdentity is equal to 0.5, "cdh50" is obtained from
       "cdh90" protein set. Finally, if other seqIdentity value is used,
       it is obtained directly from the raw set of proteins.
   2c. Does a multi sequence alignment for multi-FASTA files obtained in
       Step 2b for future use. MAFFT software with automatic selection of
       alignment algorithm is used in this step ('--auto').
   2d. Trains hidden Markov models using HMMer for each of the aligned
       KO-specific FASTA files obtained in Step 2c. This is performed with
       'hmmbuild' using the default settings.

   Step 2 may be reasonable to be re-done if the user wants to tweak the
   settings in proteins filtering, clustering, multi sequence alignment or
   HMMs training steps. However, it requires to have KO-specific protein
   FASTA files obtained in Step 1a. As such files are not provided in
   RAVEN and BioMet ToolBox, the user can only generate these files from
   KEGG FTP dump files, so KEGG FTP license is needed.

   3a. Queries the HMMs with sequences for the organism you are making a
       model for. This step uses both the output from step 1a and from 2d.
       This is done with 'hmmsearch' function under default settings. The
       significance threshold value set in 'cutOff' parameter is used
       later when parsing '*.out' files to filter out KO hits with higher
       value than 'cutOff' value. The results with passable E values are
       summarised into KO-gene occurence matrix with E values in
       intersections as 'koGeneMat'. The parameters 'minScoreRatioG' and
       'minScoreRatioKO' are then applied to 'prune' KO-gene associations
       (see the function descriptions above for more details). The
       intersection values for these 'prunable' associations are converted
       to zeroes.
   3b. Constructs a model based on the pre-processed KO-gene association
       matrix (koGeneMat). As the full KEGG model already has reaction-KO
       relationships, KOs are converted into the query genes. The final
       draft model contains only these reactions, which are associated
       with KOs from koGeneMat. The reactions without the genes may also
       be included, if the user set keepSpontaneous as 'true'.

   The Step 3 is specific to the organism for which the model is
   reconstructed.

   In principle the function looks at which output that is already available
   and runs only the parts that are required for step 3. This means
   that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
   RAVEN\external\kegg directory
   -1b is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   OR multi-FASTA files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this
   step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead
   (see above). If not all files exist it will try to find
   the KEGG database files in dataDir.
   -2a is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped
   if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -2b is only performed if not all required HMMs exist in the defined
   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA files or
   HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
   -3b is always performed.

   These steps are specific to the organism for which you are
   reconstructing the model.

   Regarding the whole pipeline, the function checks the output that is
   already available and runs only the parts that are required for step 3.
   This means that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
   RAVEN\external\kegg directory.
   -1b is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs, aligned
   FASTA files, clustered FASTA files and raw FASTA files in the defined
   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are
   downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above). If not all files
   exist it will try to find the KEGG database files in dataDir.
   -2ab are only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs,
   aligned FASTA files and clustered FASTA files in the defined dataDir.
   This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from
   BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -2c is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs and
   aligned FASTA files in the defined dataDir. This means that this step
   is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see
   above).
   -2d is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs exist in
   the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA
   files or HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
   -3b is always performed.

   NOTE: it is also possible to obtain draft model from KEGG without
   providing protein FASTA file for the target organism. In such case the
   organism three-four letter abbreviation set as 'organismID' must exist
   in the local KEGG database. In such case, the program just fetches all
   the reactions, which are associated with given 'organismID'.

   Usage: model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,...
    outDir,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,...
    keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioKO,minScoreRatioG,maxPhylDist,...
    nSequences,seqIdentity)

   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-09-28

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • constructMultiFasta constructMultiFasta
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG
  • getPhylDist getPhylDist
This function is called by:

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function files=listFiles(directory)

0223 %   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
0224 %   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
0225 %   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
0226 %   -3b is always performed.
0227 %
0228 %   These steps are specific to the organism for which you are
0229 %   reconstructing the model.
0230 %
0231 %   Regarding the whole pipeline, the function checks the output that is
0232 %   already available and runs only the parts that are required for step 3.
0233 %   This means that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
0234 %   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
0235 %   RAVEN\external\kegg directory.
0236 %   -1b is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs, aligned
0237 %   FASTA files, clustered FASTA files and raw FASTA files in the defined
0238 %   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are
0239 %   downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above). If not all files
0240 %   exist it will try to find the KEGG database files in dataDir.
0241 %   -2ab are only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs,
0242 %   aligned FASTA files and clustered FASTA files in the defined dataDir.
0243 %   This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from
0244 %   BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
0245 %   -2c is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs and
0246 %   aligned FASTA files in the defined dataDir. This means that this step
0247 %   is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see
0248 %   above).
0249 %   -2d is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs exist in
0250 %   the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA
0251 %   files or HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
0252 %   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
0253 %   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
0254 %   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
0255 %   -3b is always performed.
0256 %
0257 %   NOTE: it is also possible to obtain draft model from KEGG without
0258 %   providing protein FASTA file for the target organism. In such case the
0259 %   organism three-four letter abbreviation set as 'organismID' must exist
0260 %   in the local KEGG database. In such case, the program just fetches all
0261 %   the reactions, which are associated with given 'organismID'.
0262 %
0263 %   Usage: model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,...
0264 %    outDir,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,...
0265 %    keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioKO,minScoreRatioG,maxPhylDist,...
0266 %    nSequences,seqIdentity)
0267 %
0268 %   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2019-09-28
0269 
0270 if nargin<2
0271     fastaFile=[];
0272 end
0273 if nargin<3
0274     dataDir=[];
0275 end
0276 if nargin<4
0277     outDir=[];
0278 end
0279 if isempty(outDir)
0280     outDir=tempdir;
0281     %Delete all *.out files if any exist
0282     delete(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0283 elseif ~isstr(outDir)
0284     error('outDir should be provided as string');
0285 end
0286 if nargin<5
0287     keepSpontaneous=true;
0288 end
0289 if nargin<6
0290     keepUndefinedStoich=true;
0291 end
0292 if nargin<7
0293     keepIncomplete=true;
0294 end
0295 if nargin<8
0296     keepGeneral=false;
0297 end
0298 if nargin<9
0299     cutOff=10^-50;
0300 end
0301 if nargin<10
0302     minScoreRatioKO=0.3;
0303 end
0304 if nargin<11
0305     minScoreRatioG=0.8;
0306 end
0307 if nargin<12
0308     maxPhylDist=inf;
0309     %Include all sequences for each reaction
0310 end
0311 if nargin<13
0312     nSequences=inf;
0313     %Include all sequences for each reaction
0314 end
0315 if nargin<14
0316     seqIdentity=-1;
0317     %CD-HIT is not used in the pipeline
0318 end
0319 
0320 if isempty(fastaFile)
0321     fprintf(['\n\n*** The model reconstruction from KEGG based on the annotation available for KEGG Species <strong>' organismID '</strong> ***\n\n']);
0322 else
0323     fprintf('\n\n*** The model reconstruction from KEGG based on the protein homology search against KEGG Orthology specific HMMs ***\n\n');
0324     %Check if query fasta exists
0325     fastaFile=checkFileExistence(fastaFile,true,false);
0326 end
0327 
0328 %Run the external binaries multi-threaded to use all logical cores assigned
0329 %to MATLAB
0330 cores = evalc('feature(''numcores'')');
0331 cores = strsplit(cores, 'MATLAB was assigned: ');
0332 cores = regexp(cores{2},'^\d*','match');
0333 cores = cores{1};
0334 
0335 %Get the directory for RAVEN Toolbox. This is to get the path to the third
0336 %party software used
0337 [ST, I]=dbstack('-completenames');
0338 ravenPath=fileparts(fileparts(fileparts(ST(I).file)));
0339 
0340 %Checking if dataDir is consistent. It must point to pre-trained HMMs set,
0341 %compatible with the the current RAVEN version. The user may have the
0342 %required zip file already in working directory or have it extracted. If
0343 %the zip file and directory is not here, it is downloaded from the cloud
0344 if ~isempty(dataDir)
0345     hmmOptions={'euk100_kegg94', ...
0346         'euk90_kegg94', ...
0347         'euk50_kegg94', ...
0348         'prok100_kegg94', ...
0349         'prok90_kegg94', ...
0350         'prok50_kegg94'};
0351     hmmLinks={'wbnghgtpgftb6pcw572bhkl9a8ekh32d', ...
0352         '754bdz0965261fktzlwc77rcv7me87i6', ...
0353         '5xwgv17cn099xn7bxo2dq5h1dsdxrhn7', ...
0354         'azpn5lwrb4gind2mn5hnbmux0lao5vt5', ...
0355         'j19ybilr7js34uisnss92gvq5g6lljkk', ...
0356         'b5vn631jrwdzcj4uwmvbshe2ws3zoalm'};
0357     if all(cellfun(@isempty,regexp(dataDir,strcat(hmmOptions,'$')))) %Check if dataDir ends with any of the hmmOptions
0358         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),'file') && ...
0359                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'),'dir') && ...
0360                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned'),'dir') && ...
0361                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms'),'dir')
0362             EM='Pre-trained HMMs set is not recognised. It should match any of the following sets:';
0363             disp(EM);
0364             disp(hmmOptions);
0365             error('Fatal error occured. See the details above');
0366         end
0367     else
0368         if exist(dataDir,'dir') && exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','K00844.hmm'),'file')
0369             fprintf(['NOTE: Found <strong>' dataDir '</strong> directory with pre-trained HMMs, it will therefore be used during reconstruction\n']);
0370         elseif ~exist(dataDir,'dir') && exist([dataDir,'.zip'],'file')
0371             fprintf('Extracting the HMMs archive file... ');
0372             unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0373             fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0374         else
0375             hmmIndex=regexp(dataDir,hmmOptions);
0376             hmmIndex=~cellfun(@isempty,hmmIndex);
0377             fprintf('Downloading the HMMs archive file... ');
0378             websave([dataDir,'.zip'],['https://chalmersuniversity.box.com/shared/static/',hmmLinks{hmmIndex},'.zip']);
0379             fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0380             fprintf('Extracting the HMMs archive file... ');
0381             unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0382             fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0383         end
0384         %Check if HMMs are extracted
0385         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','K00844.hmm'),'file')
0386             EM=['The HMM files seem improperly extracted and not found in ',dataDir,'/hmms. Please remove ',dataDir,' folder and rerun getKEGGModelForOrganism'];
0387             disp(EM);
0388             error('Fatal error occured. See the details above');
0389         end
0390     end
0391 end
0392 
0393 %Check if the fasta-file contains '/' or'\'. If not then it's probably just
0394 %a file name. Expand to full path.
0395 if any(fastaFile)
0396     if ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'\')) && ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'/'))
0397         fastaFile=which(fastaFile);
0398     end
0399     %Create the required sub-folders in dataDir if they dont exist
0400     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),'dir')
0401         mkdir(dataDir,'keggdb');
0402     end
0403     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'),'dir')
0404         mkdir(dataDir,'fasta');
0405     end
0406     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned'),'dir')
0407         mkdir(dataDir,'aligned');
0408     end
0409     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms'),'dir')
0410         mkdir(dataDir,'hmms');
0411     end
0412     if ~exist(outDir,'dir')
0413         mkdir(outDir);
0414     end
0415 end
0416 
0417 %First generate the full KEGG model. The dataDir must not be supplied as
0418 %there is also an internal RAVEN version available
0419 if any(dataDir)
0420     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0421 else
0422     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG([],keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0423 end
0424 model.id=organismID;
0425 model.c=zeros(numel(model.rxns),1);
0426 
0427 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then just remove all genes which are not for
0428 %the given organism ID
0429 if isempty(fastaFile)
0430     fprintf(['Pruning the model from <strong>non-' organismID '</strong> genes... ']);
0431     if ismember(organismID,{'eukaryotes','prokaryotes'})
0432         phylDists=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0433         if strcmp(organismID,'eukaryotes')
0434             proxyid='hsa';
0435             %Use H. sapiens here
0436         else
0437             proxyid='eco';
0438             %Use E. coli here
0439         end
0440         [~, phylDistId]=ismember(proxyid,phylDists.ids);
0441         idsToKeep=phylDists.ids(~isinf(phylDists.distMat(phylDistId,:)));
0442         taxIDs=cellfun(@(x) x{1},cellfun(@(x) strsplit(x,':'),model.genes,'UniformOutput',false),'UniformOutput',false);
0443         I=ismember(upper(taxIDs),upper(idsToKeep));
0444     else
0445         %KEGG organism IDs may have three or four letters
0446         organismID=strcat(organismID,':');
0447         %Add colon for accurate matching
0448         if length(organismID)==4
0449             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:4),organismID),model.genes);
0450         elseif length(organismID)==5
0451             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:5),organismID),model.genes);
0452         end
0453     end
0454     %Remove those genes
0455     model.genes=model.genes(I);
0456     model.rxnGeneMat=model.rxnGeneMat(:,I);
0457     fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0458 end
0459 
0460 %First remove all reactions without genes
0461 if keepSpontaneous==true
0462     fprintf('Removing non-spontaneous reactions without GPR rules... ');
0463     load(fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggRxns.mat'),'isSpontaneous');
0464     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&~ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous);
0465     spontRxnsWithGenes=model.rxns(any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&~ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous));
0466 else
0467     fprintf('Removing reactions without GPR rules... ');
0468     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2);
0469 end
0470 model=removeReactions(model,I,true);
0471 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0472 
0473 %Clean gene names
0474 fprintf('Fixing gene names in the model... ');
0475 for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0476     %First get rid of the prefix organism id
0477     model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(strfind(model.genes{i},':')+1:end);
0478     %Find and remove the description in parentheses if any
0479     s=strfind(model.genes{i},'(');
0480     if any(s)
0481         model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(1:s-1);
0482     end
0483 end
0484 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0485 
0486 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then we are done here
0487 if isempty(fastaFile)
0488     %Create grRules
0489     fprintf('Constructing GPR associations and annotations for the model... ');
0490     model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0491     model.grRules(:)={''};
0492     %Add the gene associations as 'or'
0493     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0494         %Find the involved genes
0495         I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
0496         if any(I)
0497             model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
0498             for j=2:numel(I)
0499                 model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
0500             end
0501             model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
0502         end
0503     end
0504     %Fix grRules and reconstruct rxnGeneMat
0505     [grRules,rxnGeneMat] = standardizeGrRules(model); %Give detailed output
0506     model.grRules = grRules;
0507     model.rxnGeneMat = rxnGeneMat;
0508     %Add geneMiriams, assuming that it follows the syntax
0509     %kegg.genes/organismID:geneName
0510     model.geneMiriams='';
0511     for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0512         model.geneMiriams{i,1}.name{1,1}='kegg.genes';
0513         model.geneMiriams{i,1}.value{1,1}=strcat(lower(organismID),model.genes{i,1});
0514     end
0515     %Add the description to the reactions
0516     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0517         if ~isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0518             model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat('Included by getKEGGModelForOrganism (without HMMs).',model.rxnNotes(i));
0519             model.rxnNotes(i)=strrep(model.rxnNotes(i),'.','. ');
0520         else
0521             model.rxnNotes(i)={'Included by getKEGGModelForOrganism (without HMMs)'};
0522         end
0523     end
0524     fprintf('COMPLETE\n\n');
0525     fprintf('*** Model reconstruction complete ***\n');
0526     return;
0527 end
0528 
0529 %Create a phylogenetic distance structure
0530 phylDistStruct=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0531 [~, phylDistId]=ismember(model.id,phylDistStruct.ids);
0532 
0533 %Calculate the real maximal distance now. An abitary large number of 1000
0534 %is used for the "all in kingdom" or "all sequences" options. This is a bit
0535 %inconvenient way to do it, but it is to make it fit with some older code
0536 if isinf(maxPhylDist) || maxPhylDist==-1
0537     maxPhylDist=1000;
0538 end
0539 
0540 %Get the KO ids for which files have been generated. Maybe not the neatest
0541 %way..
0542 fastaFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta','*.fa'));
0543 alignedFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.fa'));
0544 alignedWorking=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.faw'));
0545 hmmFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','*.hmm'));
0546 outFiles=listFiles(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0547 
0548 %Check if multi-FASTA files should be generated. This should only be
0549 %performed if there are IDs in the KOModel structure that haven't been
0550 %parsed yet
0551 missingFASTA=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[fastaFiles;alignedFiles;hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0552 
0553 if ~isempty(missingFASTA)
0554     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),'file')
0555         EM=['The file ''genes.pep'' cannot be located at ' strrep(dataDir,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP.\n'];
0556         dispEM(EM);
0557     end
0558     %Only construct models for KOs which don't have files already
0559     fastaModel=removeReactions(KOModel,setdiff(KOModel.rxns,missingFASTA),true,true);
0560     %Permute the order of the KOs in the model so that constructMultiFasta
0561     %can be run on several processors at once
0562     fastaModel=permuteModel(fastaModel,randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(fastaModel.rxns)),'rxns');
0563     constructMultiFasta(fastaModel,fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'));
0564 else
0565     fprintf('Generating the KEGG Orthology specific multi-FASTA files... COMPLETE\n');
0566 end
0567 
0568 if isunix
0569     if ismac
0570         binEnd='.mac';
0571     else
0572         binEnd='';
0573     end
0574 elseif ispc
0575     binEnd='';
0576 else
0577     EM='Unknown OS, exiting.';
0578     disp(EM);
0579     return
0580 end
0581 
0582 %Check if alignment of FASTA files should be performed
0583 missingAligned=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[alignedFiles;hmmFiles;alignedWorking;outFiles]);
0584 if ~isempty(missingAligned)
0585     if seqIdentity==-1
0586         fprintf('Performing the multiple alignment for KEGG Orthology specific protein sets... ');
0587     else
0588         fprintf('Performing clustering and multiple alignment for KEGG Orthology specific protein sets... ');
0589     end
0590     missingAligned=missingAligned(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingAligned)));
0591     progressFlag=0;
0592     %Update fastaFiles. This is needed once rebuilding KEGG from FTP dump
0593     %files for more accurate progress reporting
0594     fastaFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta','*.fa'));
0595     %Align all sequences using MAFFT
0596     for i=1:numel(missingAligned)
0597         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0598         %parallel process. The faw-files are saved as temporary files to
0599         %kept track of which files are being worked on
0600         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'file') &&...
0601                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0602             %Check that the multi-FASTA file exists. It should do so since
0603             %we are saving empty files as well. Print a warning and
0604             %continue if not
0605             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0606                 EM=['WARNING: The multi-FASTA file for ' missingAligned{i} ' does not exist'];
0607                 dispEM(EM,false);
0608                 continue;
0609             end
0610             
0611             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0612             %file and continue
0613             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0614             if s.bytes<=0
0615                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'w');
0616                 fclose(fid);
0617                 continue;
0618             end
0619             
0620             %Create an empty file to prevent other threads to start to work
0621             %on the same alignment
0622             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'w');
0623             fclose(fid);
0624             
0625             %First load the FASTA file, then select up to nSequences
0626             %sequences of the most closely related species, apply any
0627             %constraints from maxPhylDist, and save it as a temporary file,
0628             %and create the model from that
0629             
0630             fastaStruct=fastaread(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0631             phylDist=inf(numel(fastaStruct),1);
0632             for j=1:numel(fastaStruct)
0633                 %Get the organism abbreviation
0634                 index=strfind(fastaStruct(j).Header,':');
0635                 if any(index)
0636                     abbrev=fastaStruct(j).Header(1:index(1)-1);
0637                     [~, index]=ismember(abbrev,phylDistStruct.ids);
0638                     if any(index)
0639                         phylDist(j)=phylDistStruct.distMat(index(1),phylDistId);
0640                     end
0641                 end
0642             end
0643             
0644             %Inf means that it should not be included
0645             phylDist(phylDist>maxPhylDist)=[];
0646             
0647             %Sort based on phylDist
0648             [~, order]=sort(phylDist);
0649             
0650             %Save the first nSequences hits to a temporary FASTA file
0651             if nSequences<=numel(fastaStruct)
0652                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order(1:nSequences));
0653             else
0654                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order);
0655             end
0656             
0657             %Do the clustering and alignment if there are more than one
0658             %sequences, otherwise just save the sequence (or an empty file)
0659             if numel(fastaStruct)>1
0660                 if seqIdentity==0.9
0661                     cdhitInp100=tempname;
0662                     fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0663                     cdhitInp90=tempname;
0664                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0665                     if status~=0
0666                         EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0667                         dispEM(EM);
0668                     end
0669                     %Remove the old tempfile
0670                     if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0671                         delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0672                     end
0673                     tmpFile=tempname;
0674                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.9 -n 5 -M 2000 -aL 0.8']);
0675                     if status~=0
0676                         EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0677                         dispEM(EM);
0678                     end
0679                     %Remove the old tempfile
0680                     if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0681                         delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0682                     end
0683                 elseif seqIdentity==0.5
0684                     cdhitInp100=tempname;
0685                     fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0686                     cdhitInp90=tempname;
0687                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0688                     if status~=0
0689                         EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0690                         dispEM(EM);
0691                     end
0692                     %Remove the old tempfile
0693                     if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0694                         delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0695                     end
0696                     cdhitInp50=tempname;
0697                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' cdhitInp50 '" -c 0.9 -n 5 -M 2000 -aL 0.8']);
0698                     if status~=0
0699                         EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0700                         dispEM(EM);
0701                     end
0702                     %Remove the old tempfile
0703                     if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0704                         delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0705                     end
0706                     tmpFile=tempname;
0707                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp50 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.5 -n 3 -M 2000 -aL 0.8']);
0708                     if status~=0
0709                         EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0710                         dispEM(EM);
0711                     end
0712                     %Remove the old tempfile
0713                     if exist(cdhitInp50, 'file')
0714                         delete([cdhitInp50 '*']);
0715                     end
0716                 elseif seqIdentity~=-1
0717                     cdhitInpCustom=tempname;
0718                     fastawrite(cdhitInpCustom,fastaStruct);
0719                     tmpFile=tempname;
0720                     if seqIdentity<=1 && seqIdentity>0.7
0721                         [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 5 -M 2000']);
0722                     elseif seqIdentity>0.6
0723                         [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 4 -M 2000']);
0724                     elseif seqidentity>0.5
0725                         [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 3 -M 2000']);
0726                     elseif seqidentity>0.4
0727                         [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 2 -M 2000']);
0728                     else
0729                         EM='The provided seqIdentity must be between 0 and 1\n';
0730                         dispEM(EM);
0731                     end
0732                     if status~=0
0733                         EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0734                         dispEM(EM);
0735                     end
0736                     %Remove the old tempfile
0737                     if exist(cdhitInpCustom, 'file')
0738                         delete([cdhitInpCustom '*']);
0739                     end
0740                 else
0741                     %This means that CD-HIT should be skipped since
0742                     %seqIdentity is equal to -1
0743                     tmpFile=tempname;
0744                     fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0745                 end
0746                 %Do the alignment for this file
0747                 if ismac
0748                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft','mafft-mac','mafft.bat') '" --auto --anysymbol --thread "' num2str(cores) '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0749                 elseif isunix
0750                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft','mafft-linux64','mafft.bat') '" --auto --anysymbol --thread "' num2str(cores) '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0751                 elseif ispc
0752                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft','mafft-win','mafft.bat') '" --auto --anysymbol --thread "' num2str(cores) '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0753                 end
0754                 if status~=0
0755                     %It could be that alignment failed because only one
0756                     %sequence was left after clustering. If that is the
0757                     %case, then the clustered file is just copied as 'faw'
0758                     %file
0759                     if any(regexp(output,'Only 1 sequence found'))
0760                         movefile(tmpFile,fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'f');
0761                     else
0762                         EM=['Error when performing alignment of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0763                         dispEM(EM);
0764                     end
0765                 end
0766                 %Remove the old tempfile
0767                 if exist(tmpFile, 'file')
0768                     delete([tmpFile '*']);
0769                 end
0770             else
0771                 %If there is only one sequence then it's not possible to do
0772                 %a multiple alignment. Just print the sequence instead. An
0773                 %empty file was written previously so that doesn't have to
0774                 %be dealt with
0775                 if numel(fastaStruct)==1
0776                     fastawrite(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fastaStruct);
0777                 end
0778             end
0779             %Move the temporary file to the real one
0780             movefile(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'f');
0781             
0782             %Print the progress: no need to update this for every
0783             %iteration, just report once 25%, 50% and 75% are done
0784             if progressFlag==0 && i>numel(missingAligned)*0.25
0785                 fprintf('%*.*f%% complete',5,2,(numel(listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'*.fa')))/numel(fastaFiles))*100);
0786                 progressFlag=progressFlag+1;
0787             elseif (progressFlag==1 && i>=numel(missingAligned)*0.5) || (progressFlag==2 && i>=numel(missingAligned)*0.75)
0788                 fprintf('\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b%*.*f%% complete',5,2,(numel(listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'*.fa')))/numel(fastaFiles))*100);
0789                 progressFlag=progressFlag+1;
0790             end
0791         end
0792     end
0793     fprintf('\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\bCOMPLETE\n');
0794 else
0795     if seqIdentity==-1
0796         fprintf('Performing the multiple alignment for KEGG Orthology specific protein sets... COMPLETE\n');
0797     else
0798         fprintf('Performing clustering and multiple alignment for KEGG Orthology specific protein sets... COMPLETE\n');
0799     end
0800 end
0801 
0802 %Check if training of Hidden Markov models should be performed
0803 missingHMMs=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0804 if ~isempty(missingHMMs)
0805     fprintf('Training the KEGG Orthology specific HMMs... ');
0806     missingHMMs=missingHMMs(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingHMMs)));
0807     progressFlag=0;
0808     %Update alignedFiles. This is needed once rebuilding KEGG from FTP dump
0809     %files for more accurate progress reporting
0810     alignedFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.fa'));
0811     %Train models for all missing KOs
0812     for i=1:numel(missingHMMs)
0813         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0814         %parallel process
0815         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'file') && ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'file')
0816             %Check that the aligned FASTA file exists. It could be that it
0817             %is still being worked on by some other instance of the program
0818             %(the .faw file should then exist). This should not happen on a
0819             %single computer. It doesn't throw an error, because it should
0820             %finalize the ones it can
0821             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']),'file')
0822                 EM=['The aligned FASTA file for ' missingHMMs{i} ' does not exist'];
0823                 dispEM(EM,false);
0824                 continue;
0825             end
0826             
0827             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0828             %file and continue
0829             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']));
0830             if s.bytes<=0
0831                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'w');
0832                 fclose(fid);
0833                 continue;
0834             end
0835             %Create a temporary file to indicate that it is working on the
0836             %KO. This is because hmmbuild cannot overwrite existing files
0837             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'w');
0838             fclose(fid);
0839             
0840             %Create HMM
0841             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer',['hmmbuild' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' num2str(cores) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']) '"']);
0842             if status~=0
0843                 EM=['Error when training HMM for ' missingHMMs{i} ':\n' output];
0844                 dispEM(EM);
0845             end
0846             
0847             %Delete the temporary file
0848             delete(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']));
0849             
0850             %Print the progress: no need to update this for every
0851             %iteration, just report once 25%, 50% and 75% are done
0852             if progressFlag==0 && i>numel(missingHMMs)*0.25
0853                 fprintf('%*.*f%% complete',5,2,(numel(listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'*.hmm')))/numel(alignedFiles))*100);
0854                 progressFlag=progressFlag+1;
0855             elseif (progressFlag==1 && i>=numel(missingHMMs)*0.5) || (progressFlag==2 && i>=numel(missingHMMs)*0.75)
0856                 fprintf('\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b%*.*f%% complete',5,2,(numel(listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'*.hmm')))/numel(alignedFiles))*100);
0857                 progressFlag=progressFlag+1;
0858             end
0859         end
0860     end
0861     fprintf('\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\bCOMPLETE\n');
0862 else
0863     fprintf('Training the KEGG Orthology specific HMMs... COMPLETE\n');
0864 end
0865 
0866 %Check which new .out files that should be generated. Check if training of
0867 %Hidden Markov models should be performed
0868 missingOUT=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,outFiles);
0869 if ~isempty(missingOUT)
0870     fprintf(['Querying <strong>' strrep(fastaFile,'\','/') '</strong> against the KEGG Orthology specific HMMs... ']);
0871     missingOUT=missingOUT(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingOUT)));
0872     progressFlag=0;
0873     %Update hmmFiles. This is needed once rebuilding KEGG from FTP dump
0874     %files for more accurate progress reporting
0875     hmmFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','*.hmm'));
0876     for i=1:numel(missingOUT)
0877         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0878         %parallel process
0879         if ~exist(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'file')
0880             %Check that the HMM file exists. It should do so since %we are
0881             %saving empty files as well. Print a warning and continue if
0882             %not
0883             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']),'file')
0884                 EM=['The HMM file for ' missingOUT{i} ' does not exist'];
0885                 dispEM(EM,false);
0886                 continue;
0887             end
0888             
0889             %Save an empty file to prevent several threads working on the
0890             %same file
0891             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0892             fclose(fid);
0893             
0894             %If the HMM file is empty then save an out file and continue
0895             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']));
0896             if s.bytes<=0
0897                 continue;
0898             end
0899             
0900             %Check each gene in the input file against this model
0901             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer',['hmmsearch' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' num2str(cores) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fastaFile '"']);
0902             if status~=0
0903                 EM=['Error when querying HMM for ' missingOUT{i} ':\n' output];
0904                 dispEM(EM);
0905             end
0906             
0907             %Save the output to a file
0908             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0909             fwrite(fid,output);
0910             fclose(fid);
0911             
0912             %Print the progress: no need to update this for every
0913             %iteration, just report once 25%, 50% and 75% are done
0914             if progressFlag==0 && i>numel(missingOUT)*0.25
0915                 fprintf('%*.*f%% complete',5,2,(numel(listFiles(fullfile(outDir,'*.out')))/numel(hmmFiles))*100);
0916                 progressFlag=progressFlag+1;
0917             elseif (progressFlag==1 && i>=numel(missingOUT)*0.5) || (progressFlag==2 && i>=numel(missingOUT)*0.75)
0918                 fprintf('\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b%*.*f%% complete',5,2,(numel(listFiles(fullfile(outDir,'*.out')))/numel(hmmFiles))*100);
0919                 progressFlag=progressFlag+1;
0920             end
0921         end
0922     end
0923     fprintf('\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\bCOMPLETE\n');
0924 else
0925     fprintf(['Querying <strong>' fastaFile '</strong> against the KEGG Orthology specific HMMs... COMPLETE\n']);
0926 end
0927 
0928 
0929 %***Begin retrieving the output and putting together the resulting model
0930 
0931 fprintf('Parsing the HMM search results... ');
0932 %Retrieve matched genes from the HMMs
0933 koGeneMat=zeros(numel(KOModel.rxns),3000); %Make room for 3000 genes
0934 genes=cell(3000,1);
0935 %Store the best score for a gene in a hash list (since it will be searching
0936 %many times)
0937 hTable = java.util.Hashtable;
0938 
0939 geneCounter=0;
0940 for i=1:numel(KOModel.rxns)
0941     if exist(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']), 'file')
0942         fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']),'r');
0943         beginMatches=false;
0944         while 1
0945             %Get the next line
0946             tline = fgetl(fid);
0947             
0948             %Abort at end of file
0949             if ~ischar(tline)
0950                 break;
0951             end
0952             
0953             if and(beginMatches,strcmp(tline,'  ------ inclusion threshold ------'))
0954                 break;
0955             end
0956             
0957             if beginMatches==false
0958                 %This is how the listing of matches begins
0959                 if any(strfind(tline,'E-value '))
0960                     %Read one more line that is only padding
0961                     tline = fgetl(fid);
0962                     beginMatches=true;
0963                 end
0964             else
0965                 %If matches should be read
0966                 if ~strcmp(tline,'   [No hits detected that satisfy reporting thresholds]') && ~isempty(tline)
0967                     elements=regexp(tline,' ','split');
0968                     elements=elements(cellfun(@any,elements));
0969                     
0970                     %Check if the match is below the treshhold
0971                     score=str2double(elements{1});
0972                     gene=elements{9};
0973                     if score<=cutOff
0974                         %If the score is exactly 0, change it to a very
0975                         %small value to avoid NaN
0976                         if score==0
0977                             score=10^-250;
0978                         end
0979                         %Check if the gene is added already and, is so, get
0980                         %the best score for it
0981                         I=hTable.get(gene);
0982                         if any(I)
0983                             koGeneMat(i,I)=score;
0984                         else
0985                             geneCounter=geneCounter+1;
0986                             %The gene was not present yet so add it
0987                             hTable.put(gene,geneCounter);
0988                             genes{geneCounter}=gene;
0989                             koGeneMat(i,geneCounter)=score;
0990                         end
0991                     end
0992                 else
0993                     break;
0994                 end
0995             end
0996         end
0997         fclose(fid);
0998     end
0999 end
1000 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
1001 
1002 fprintf('Removing gene, KEGG Orthology associations below minScoreRatioKO, minScoreRatioG... ');
1003 koGeneMat=koGeneMat(:,1:geneCounter);
1004 
1005 %Remove the genes for each KO that are below minScoreRatioKO.
1006 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,1)
1007     J=find(koGeneMat(i,:));
1008     if any(J)
1009         koGeneMat(i,J(log(koGeneMat(i,J))/log(min(koGeneMat(i,J)))<minScoreRatioKO))=0;
1010     end
1011 end
1012 
1013 %Remove the KOs for each gene that are below minScoreRatioG
1014 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,2)
1015     J=find(koGeneMat(:,i));
1016     if any(J)
1017         koGeneMat(J(log(koGeneMat(J,i))/log(min(koGeneMat(J,i)))<minScoreRatioG),i)=0;
1018     end
1019 end
1020 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
1021 
1022 fprintf('Adding gene annotations to the model... ');
1023 %Create the new model
1024 model.genes=genes(1:geneCounter);
1025 model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
1026 model.grRules(:)={''};
1027 model.rxnGeneMat=sparse(numel(model.rxns),numel(model.genes));
1028 
1029 %Loop through the reactions and add the corresponding genes
1030 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
1031     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
1032         %Get all KOs
1033         I=find(strcmpi(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name,'kegg.orthology'));
1034         KOs=model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I);
1035         %Find the KOs and the corresponding genes
1036         J=ismember(KOModel.rxns,KOs);
1037         [~, K]=find(koGeneMat(J,:));
1038         
1039         if any(K)
1040             model.rxnGeneMat(i,K)=1;
1041             %Also delete KOs for which no genes were found. If no genes at
1042             %all were matched to the reaction it will be deleted later
1043             L=sum(koGeneMat(J,:),2)==0;
1044             model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I(L))=[];
1045             model.rxnMiriams{i}.name(I(L))=[];
1046         end
1047     end
1048 end
1049 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
1050 
1051 %Find and delete all reactions without genes. This also removes genes that
1052 %are not used (which could happen because minScoreRatioG and
1053 %minScoreRatioKO). If keepSpontaneous==true, the spontaneous reactions
1054 %without genes are kept in the model. Spontaneous reactions with original
1055 %gene associations are treated in the same way, like the rest of the
1056 %reactions - if gene associations were removed during HMM search, such
1057 %reactions are deleted from the model
1058 if keepSpontaneous==true
1059     %Not the most comprise way to delete reactions without genes, but this
1060     %makes the code easier to understand. Firstly the non-spontaneous
1061     %reactions without genes are removed. After that, the second deletion
1062     %step removes spontaneous reactions, which had gene associations before
1063     %HMM search, but no longer have after it
1064     fprintf('Removing non-spontaneous reactions which after HMM search no longer have GPR rules... ');
1065     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&~ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous);
1066     model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
1067     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&ismember(model.rxns,spontRxnsWithGenes);
1068     model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
1069 else
1070     %Just simply check for any new reactions without genes and remove
1071     %it
1072     fprintf('Removing reactions which after HMM search no longer have GPR rules... ');
1073     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2);
1074     model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
1075 end
1076 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
1077 
1078 fprintf('Constructing GPR rules and finalizing the model... ');
1079 %Add the gene associations as 'or'
1080 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
1081     %Find the involved genes
1082     I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
1083     if any(I)
1084         model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
1085         for j=2:numel(I)
1086             model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
1087         end
1088         model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
1089     end
1090 end
1091 
1092 %Fix grRules and reconstruct rxnGeneMat
1093 [grRules,rxnGeneMat] = standardizeGrRules(model,false); %Give detailed output
1094 model.grRules = grRules;
1095 model.rxnGeneMat = rxnGeneMat;
1096 
1097 %Add the description to the reactions
1098 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
1099     if ~isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
1100         model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat('Included by getKEGGModelForOrganism (using HMMs).',model.rxnNotes(i));
1101         model.rxnNotes(i)=strrep(model.rxnNotes(i),'.','. ');
1102     else
1103         model.rxnNotes(i)={'Included by getKEGGModelForOrganism (using HMMs)'};
1104     end
1105 end
1106 fprintf('COMPLETE\n\n*** Model reconstruction complete ***\n');
1107 end
1108 
1109 function files=listFiles(directory)
1110 %Supporter function to list the files in a directory and return them as a
1111 %cell array
1112 temp=dir(directory);
1113 files=cell(numel(temp),1);
1114 for i=1:numel(temp)
1115     files{i}=temp(i,1).name;
1116 end
1117 files=strrep(files,'.fa','');
1118 files=strrep(files,'.hmm','');
1119 files=strrep(files,'.out','');
1120 files=strrep(files,'.faw','');
1121 end
